passage: In the 1950s, influential American writer William S. Burroughs introduced the 'cut-up technique,' a creative method that involved cutting up existing texts and rearranging them to create new narratives. This approach to writing was particularly groundbreaking, as it challenged traditional narrative structures and emphasized the role of chance and randomness in the creative process. The technique would later influence various artistic movements, including punk rock and avant-garde filmmaking.
question: Which choice best states the main purpose of the text?

choices.A: To introduce the cut-up technique and explain its significance in challenging traditional narrative structures
choices.B: To compare the creative process of William S. Burroughs to other authors of the same time period
choices.C: To discuss the personal life and background of William S. Burroughs in relation to his literary career
choices.D: To analyze the impact of the cut-up technique on the commercial success of Burroughs' works

explanation: A: 'To introduce the cut-up technique and explain its significance in challenging traditional narrative structures' is the correct answer because the passage focuses on the introduction of the cut-up technique by William S. Burroughs and its role in challenging conventional writing methods and narrative structures.
distractor_explanation: 'To compare the creative process of William S. Burroughs to other authors of the same time period' is incorrect because the passage does not discuss any other authors or compare their creative processes.
'To discuss the personal life and background of William S. Burroughs in relation to his literary career' is incorrect because the passage does not delve into Burroughs' personal life or background.

'To analyze the impact of the cut-up technique on the commercial success of Burroughs' works' is incorrect because the passage does not address the commercial success of Burroughs' works, focusing instead on the technique's influence on artistic movements.
